Section.title: Overview
Section.Paragraph: This section of the documentation describes the implementation or theory of operation for the application. Knowing how the application works internally can be useful when trying to determine why something doesn't appear to be working the way it should be.

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph:
This section of the documentation details the
permissions
used by the application, and the reasons for requiring those permissions.

Subsection.title: android.permission.INTERNET
Subsection.Paragraph: The application requires the android.permission.INTERNET permission in order to talk to external S3 servers.

Subsection.title: android.permission.CHANGE_NETWORK_STATE
Subsection.Paragraph: The application requires the android.permission.CHANGE_NETWORK_STATE permission in order to determine if networking is currently available. Unfortunately, Android requires applications to use the android.permission.CHANGE_NETWORK_STATE permission just to read the networking state, even if they have no intention of changing the network state. Bizarrely, Android also exposes an android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE permission, but this apparently is not sufficient to access the ConnectivityManager class used to monitor the networking status.

Subsection.title: android.permission.RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED
Subsection.Paragraph: The application requires the android.permission.RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED permission in order to be notified that the device has finished booting up. The application starts up a background service that will periodically schedule uploads. This ensures that users don't need to remember to start the application every time they reboot their device; forgetting to start the application might mean that critical data backups don't get executed!

Subsection.title: android.permission.CAMERA
Subsection.Paragraph: The application requires the android.permission.CAMERA permission in order to use camera to scan QR codes to configure buckets.
